channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: My Word for 2024: Strong
item.description: Before I begin, know that I fully recognize that it’s May. I selected my word of the year way back in December of 2023. After letting it marinade for a few days, I spent an hour looking for the perfect bracelet on Etsy that would display its letters each and every day. I also knew... Read More

item.title: This Refreshing One-Bowl Peanut-Avocado Chaat Salad Packs A Citrus Twist
item.description: It features the crispy, tangy, sweet street food known as chaat.

item.title: Comprehensive testing leads to targeted treatment for rare autoimmune encephalitis antibody
item.description: What started as a persistent headache for Spencer Lodin soon devolved into slowed speech, seizures, and hallucinations, symptoms which stumped ER doctors into thinking he had meningitis or was suffering from psychosis. Finally, specialized testing at Mayo Clinic identified Spencer's condition as GFAP-IgG associated autoimmune encephalitis, which allowed for targeted treatment and a full recovery. […] The post Comprehensive testing leads to targeted treatment for rare autoimmune encephalitis antibody appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: The Sound of Freedom
item.description: For a million years (more like 15,) I’ve been listening to a radio show: The Taylor Strecker Show. It’s a daily show that originated on SiriusXM and through a series of events became an independently broadcasted show on Patreon. There’s something interesting that happens when you listen to a daily show. You get to know... Read More

item.title: This Underrated Skin Care Ingredient Can Also Improve Hair Fullness & Growth
item.description: New research indicates that a surprising ingredient may ultimately support scalp health and hair retention. Here’s what we know.

item.title: Professional broadcaster gets her voice back
item.description: Broadcaster Leslye Gale experienced gradual voice loss but was determined to tough it out on the air. Finally, in February 2024, her vocal folds had grown so weak that she had no voice at all. Given that her job as an announcer for a radio station in Orlando keeps her on air for five hours each […] The post Professional broadcaster gets her voice back appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: That Time I Went to the Eras Tour [Part Two]
item.description: To review part one of this adventure with Taylor Swift, click here. Click here to see all the Instagram highlight videos from Denver Night One. Mile High Stadium was pink and sparkly from head to toe. Never had I ever seen so many women in one place, nor so many generations piled into one venue. ... Read More

item.description: A complete guide

item.title: Mayo Clinic names new Department of Neurosurgery chair in Rochester
item.description: ROCHESTER, Minn. — Gelareh Zadeh, M.D., Ph.D., has been named the new Mayo Clinic Department of Neurosurgery chair in Rochester, beginning in the fall of 2024. Dr. Zadeh joins Mayo Clinic from the University of Toronto, where she is the University of Health Network's division head of Neurosurgery, the medical director of the Krembil Neuroscience […] The post Mayo Clinic names new Department of Neurosurgery chair in Rochester appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: That Time I Went to the Eras Tour [Part One]
item.description: Do you ever have one of those experiences where you want to remember exactly how you felt? That’s how I feel about my experience at the Taylor Swift concert this weekend. Correction: At the Eras Tour. Saying it was a concert does not feel like enough to justify the magnitude of the event. Let’s talk about the... Read More

item.title: These 3 Myths Are Getting In Between Women & Their Fitness Goals
item.description: Stronger, not smaller.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: What is this bright red birthmark on my baby?
item.description: A hemangioma, also known as a strawberry birthmark, is a bright red birthmark that shows up in the first or second week of life. It looks like a rubbery bump and is made up of extra blood vessels in the skin. In this Mayo Clinic Minute, Dr. Megha Tollefson, a Mayo Clinic pediatric dermatologist, explains […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: What is this bright red birthmark on my baby? appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.

item.title: Jenny Craig Recipe Creation: Turkey Philly Baguette
item.description: Special thanks to Jenny Craig for their sponsorship of this post. In honor of the Super Bowl this year, I decided to make a Philly to enjoy. item.title: Podiatrists Say This Simple Hack Seriously Boosts Your Post-Workout Recovery
item.description: These shoes help me come back faster & stronger.

item.title: In case you missed it: This week’s Top 5 stories on social media
item.description: Check out a few of the most popular News Network stories on @mayoclinic social media this past week. Mayo Clinic Minute: New chemotherapy approach for treating stomach cancer A new approach to treating stomach cancers called hyperthermic intraperitoneal chemotherapy (HIPEC) delivers heated liquid chemotherapy directly to the abdomen where it can target the cancer. Dr. […] The post In case you missed it: This week’s Top 5 stories on social media appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .
